title: Christie Brinkley’s Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Shoot at Age 63 Combats Ageism
text: Christie Brinkley Is Here to Remind You That Women Don’t Have an “Expiration Date” February 7, 2017 10:10 PM by Monica Kim Photo: Getty Images Christie Brinkley is a Sports Illustrated Swimsuit icon . From 1979 to 1981, the legendary supermodel scored three consecutive covers, an unprecedented move at the time. Today, Brinkley broke through yet another barrier by returning to the magazine with her daughters Sailor Brinkley Cook and Alexa Ray Joel—still bikini-clad at age 63. Posing in a bright red two-piece, Brinkley appears as relaxed and confident in her skin as she did in her 20s, providing compelling proof that one’s age is insignificant. “In a country that’s very ageist, people love to put you in little boxes—women feel very limited by their numbers,” Brinkley explained in an interview , of the deeper reason behind her participation. “On a personal level, I thought, if I can pull this off, I think it will help redefine those numbers and remove some of the fear of aging.” It’s a powerful statement that resonates with the anti-ageist movement sweeping through fashion—see Lauren Hutton’s showstopping turn on Bottega Veneta’s Spring 2017 runway and subsequent campaign—one that brings a message of inclusiveness to the fore. Or, as Brinkley puts it: “Good things come in packages of every size and we do not come with an expiration date.” Recommended For You
